page.title: 03LOCAL ISSUES (2)
page.content: Some people get cross with the children because they go to the tip and ride bicycles on the pavement. {THE TIP} To start off with, the tip was a sand quarry. Then they needed somewhere to tip rubbish and this was the only suitable place. The toys that they tip encourage children to go up, but they should realise that it is against the law.To stop them signs are put up but that doesn't stop many. {CYCLING ON THE PAVEMENT} Riding on the pavement protects you from big lorries which create big gusts of wind behind them. This can blow you off your bike. When a lorry goes past to the tip the things come off the back and dust gets in your face. It is bad to ride on the pavements because you could run into an old person and trip them over.
